name: obduracy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving the quality of being very determined to act in a particular way despite what anyone else says: The failure of the peace talks was caused by the obduracy of both leaders. Her obduracy on the subject was driving away her friends and supporters.
the quality of refusing to change your mind, or of being difficult to deal with or change: The obduracy of the police in failing to take the complaint seriously is deeply troubling. Analysts have been surprised by the obduracy of the price of oil.
More examplesFewer examplesUnless they will work to overcome their obduracy, it's hard to see how they will ever be friends.The obduracy of the stain meant that we had to bring in specialist carpet cleaners to remove it.
